column4: hi.. can anyone help me with nfs? i have set up a nfs server on my other comp.. but when i try to mount it i get a permission denied on my local machine
mount: 192.168.0.1:/ failed, reason given by server: tkomst nekas
what guide did u follow for nfs?
the one on their home
how did u edit /etc/exports ?
yes.. and i edited hosts.deny and .allow
are u sure about the IPs?
yeah.. :P
the server is 2?
and yours is 01?
what do u get with  rpcinfo -p ?
lots of stuff.. the things thats suposed to be on :)
did u type the line to auto mount on startup?
nope
is writing ALL: 192.168.0.2 in allow and ALL:ALL in .deny the right way to do it?
no
ok.. i read somewhere that it FIRST check allow.. and if it's not in allow it check deny.. and if it's in none it allow anyway
it's ok that way
ok.. wonder whats wrong then :(
did u reboot?
well i've seen it working after a reboot, even though it's not the linux way to make an app work lol
ok :P
